Posts.Content: Gcramer1110 wrote: Hello Question for anyone who has been through this same situation. I went to a follow up appt. (had a lumpectomy in 2011) and on the ultrasound (due to my age 25) showed another lump, almost in the same location as the one I had removed in 2011. The lump can not be felt but very visual in the ultrasound. I do have a long history of maternal breast cancer, including my mother and grandmother and so on. My anxiety is high then it has ever been in my entire life. I do have scheduled surgery for Nov 20. My question is is a non papable lump more serious then a papable lump? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Solid mass seen but not felt. Gcramer1110

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2013 07:07AM Gcramer1110 wrote: I appreciate the feed back. It feels as if Nov 20th will never get here. I wish there could be more answers said by looking at an ultrasound. I will talk to my primary physician about things to do for anxiety. It really starts to affect my children and sometimes husband. Thank you all!
Posts.Title: Solid mass seen but not felt. Gcramer1110
